oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pilgrim Emanuel Baptist Church, 1969
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Pilgrim Emanuel Baptist Church, located at 945 Douglas Avenue. Pilgrim Emanuel Baptist Church was founded in the late 1880s, with the congregation gathering above an ice cream company's offices on 6th Avenue South. The church was moved to Peabody Street in 1907 and it later moved to Division Street. The new church building on Douglas Avenue was dedicated in February of 1969. Photographed by R.W. Ray of the Nashville Housing Authority, 1969. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.);
